meanings.definition: A type of worm commonly used as fishing bait.
meanings.sent1: I went fishing and used an angleworm as bait.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman caught a big fish using an angleworm.
meanings.sent3: The angleworm wiggled on the hook, trying to escape.
meanings.sent4: The angleworm danced on the water's surface, tempting the fish below.
meanings.sent5: The squirming angleworm attracted the hungry fish.

meanings.definition: A long, slender worm with a segmented body.
meanings.sent1: I found an angleworm in the garden, wriggling in the soil.
meanings.sent2: The angleworm stretched out along the ground, moving slowly.
meanings.sent3: The angleworm and the earth seemed to be good friends, always together.
meanings.sent4: The angleworm's body resembled a tiny, living rope.
meanings.sent5: The angleworm's movements were graceful, like a dancer in the dirt.

meanings.definition: To fish with an angleworm as bait.
meanings.sent1: I like to angleworm when I go fishing by the lake.
meanings.sent2: He angledwormed all day but didn't catch any fish.
meanings.sent3: She decided to angleworm for her dinner, hoping for a fresh catch.
meanings.sent4: The old man taught his grandson how to angleworm in the river.
meanings.sent5: They planned to angleworm early in the morning to catch the sunrise.
